meanings.definition: A hole drilled in rock or earth for the purpose of blasting.
meanings.sent1: The miners carefully inspected the blastholes before setting off the explosion.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew drilled several blastholes in the quarry to prepare for the controlled explosion.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel peeked into the blastholes, wondering what treasures might be hidden inside.
meanings.sent4: The blastholes in the mountain resembled tiny mouths waiting to devour the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The echo of the blast reverberated through the blastholes, creating a thunderous symphony.

meanings.definition: The act of drilling holes for explosives.
meanings.sent1: The team's expertise in creating precise blastholes ensured the success of the mining operation.
meanings.sent2: Safety protocols required all workers to wear helmets during blastholes drilling.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the fastest blastholes drilling time was fierce among the workers.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of the drill echoed through the valley as the blastholes were carefully created.
meanings.sent5: The foreman's skillful hands swiftly maneuvered the drill, creating perfect blastholes in record time.

meanings.definition: The location where explosives are placed for blasting.
meanings.sent1: The engineers marked the blastholes with caution tape to prevent any accidents.
meanings.sent2: The detonation team carefully inserted the explosives into the designated blastholes.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the edge of the blastholes, unaware of the impending explosion.
meanings.sent4: The sun cast long shadows over the barren landscape, highlighting the rows of blastholes waiting to be ignited.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation built as the countdown began, each second bringing the blastholes closer to detonation.
